reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night in May because we needed to be near the train station and the Maikol had good reviews for a good price. We had spent 3 days in Rome then 4 days in Florence, and took the train back in to Rome from Florence for our one final day in Rome before our return trip home. We then took the Leonardo Express train from Termini to the airport in the morning. The hotel is on the Piazza Vittorio Emanuele, which has a metro station. It is not far from the Termini train station but we ended up taking the metro from the hotel to the Termini when we left because it is probably about a 6 or 7 block walk from the entrace to Termini, which is kind of a pain even with small rolling suitcases. The area surrounding Termini and the Piazza Vittorio Emanuele is a bit seedy. Next time I would just stay near a metro but would not try to be near Termini.
reviews.title: Fine for the budget traveler who needs to be near the train station.

reviews.text: The hotel (which is really a bed and breakfast) is very difficult to find. We walked around the entire square before we finally located it. You have to press a buzzer to get into the courtyard, then another buzzer to get to the elevator, then someone has to let you in to the front door of the B&B. This is fine but if you want to do a lot of coming and going, it's a bit awkward, especially if you are out late at night.
reviews.title: If you look for a B&B for one night close to Termini railway station, Maikol is perfect.

reviews.text: Our room was adequate for our needs. It had an air conditioner, but if you use the air conditioner you have to close the windows, which are like shutters and which therefore block out all natural light when closed. The overhead lights were fluorescent, which I find a little depressing. There are no common areas, so a breakfast of cappuccinos and sugary croissants is brought to your room at the hour you request.
reviews.title: A great place to stay in Rome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For one night, the price was right, but next time I would stay somewhere in a nicer location and would prefer a traditional hotel where you don't have to pass through locked three doors before reaching the door to your room.
reviews.title: They try Harder

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maikol really is a mixed bag: Once, it is hard to find. Then, based on their website, you expect some sort of hotel, but instead you wind yourself through staircases (or an elevator) into a residential building. The first feel is a bit like in a dorm.
reviews.title: LOVED THIS PLACE- GOOD HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Maikol in early May 2009 for a sightseeing trip around Rome (three nights). The rooms were very clean, big and the breakfast was basic but filling. The hotel overlooks a large square, but is surprisingly quiet. Our only little complaint was that it is kind of hard to find since there are zero signs outside saying there's a hotel there. Basically it's behind a large wooden door that's sandwiched between two shops. You have to get buzzed in (there are also apartments that share the space), then go up the elevator to the hotel. Once you get it once it's easy.
reviews.title: Very clean hotel with super-nice staff

reviews.text: If you want to walk from the train station to the hotel it's about 10-15 minutes away. Otherwise the subway is right at the hotel's doorstep (make sure you get out at the correct exit once you're at the Vittorio Emanuele stop!)
reviews.title: Great hotel, location good, hard to find.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at night time to Piazza Vittorio Emanuele we could not find the hotel entrance as it is concealed, however Betty (the owner) was fantastic and came down to meet us after i rang to say we got lost. This was the only point. The rooms are very clean and the breakfast is good. We felt safe in the hotel (mainly due to great security to get into it and the warmth of the owner) and i am normally quite hard to please!! The view was nice too. There is a fridge/mini bar in the room. Overall good value for money.
reviews.title: Very pleseant stay in Rome

reviews.text: Me and my wife wanted a room with breakfast near centrum of Rome. The room was very new, clean and well prepered. The owner(?) was very friendly and helpful. The only negative thing was that there were table and dining cheers,- but no problem with eating the breakfast in the bed!
reviews.title: Unexpectedly Brilliant - the breakfast in bed was the icing on the cake!
